thread.title: WTM London 2015 pulls in over 100 new exhibitorsTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: WTM London 2015 pulls in over 100 new exhibitorsTravelandtourworld.com
text:
WTM London 2015 pulls in over 100 new exhibitors Published on : Friday, August 21, 2015
WTM London 2015, the leading global event for the industry, promises to be over the edge. More than 100 new exhibitors including airlines, luxury resorts and technology specialists from a comprehensive range of sectors and countries have signed up for World Travel Market London 2015.
The event to be held at ExCeL London between Monday, November 2 and Thursday, November 5 will be attended by Flag-carriers such as Avianca and Kuwait Airways and high-profile tourist boards from as far afield as Orlando, Tokyo and Scotland.
As a first North America will welcome Visit Orlando, the official tourism association for the most visited destination in the US and the Caribbean region shall witness the debut of the Caribbean Hotel & Tourism Association.
Europe is welcoming 16 new names, including Ibiza’s tourism promotion agency; tour operator Premier Holidays; and Liberation Route Europe, an international remembrance trail that connects important milestones from the Second World War while Latin America has four new exhibitors, including Colombia’s flag-carrier Avianca and Brazil’s Caiman Ecoturismo.
Asia has wooed eight new exhibitors, such as representation firm Khiri Travel, which has offices in eight countries; and the Tokyo Convention & Visitors Bureau.
Six fresh faces will be seen from the UK and Ireland zone including VisitScotland which is taking its own stand for the first time; Norfolk Broads boating holiday firm Herbert Woods; B2B accommodation specialist Vanilla Tours; and group travel organiser The Group Company.
India, sponsor for the WTM Buyers’ Club, has attracted seven new exhibitors.
They include Hotel Pushkar Palace in Rajasthan; destination management company Orange; and the tourism department of the state of Telangana.
Middle East has seven and Africa has eight new exhibitors.
WTM London, Senior Exhibition Director, Simon Press said: “It is great to see more than 100 new exhibitors already signed up for WTM 2015, and I’m thrilled to see the vast range of destinations and sectors that they represent.
